title: The Circle reveals game-changing twist as new arrival Paddy Smyth joins show
text:
Paddy has joined The Circle (Picture: Channel 4)

The Circle threw a new player into the mix during a special live show, while revealing a new twist which adds a new paired-up dynamic.

Paddy Smyth, 31, was revealed as the latest contestant to join the Channel 4 show, who is a sales account manager from Dublin.

Paddy suffers cerebral palsy in his legs due to his mum having cancer in the womb while she was pregnant.

While his status is ‘seeing someone new’, he’s aiming to flirt up a storm with the boys if he gets the chance – with his sights set on Jack from the outset.

Paddy was flirting with Jack from the outset (Picture: Channel 4)

Even though Jack is straight, he seems up for flirting too if it keeps Paddy on his side, s

‘I tell you what, if he’s gay maybe he’ll fancy me,’ Jack said. ‘I’ll take all the fancy points I can get.’

The biggest news however arrived after the ratings, which found Jack and Beth at the bottom and at risk of being blocked from the show.

In a twist, host Emma Willis revealed how viewers now have two options; they can either vote to have Jack and Beth team-up as one catfish, 62-year-old Joyce, or bring in a new couple, Ryan and Lauren, who will act solely under Ryan’s profile.

Will you bring in Ryan and Lauren? (Picture: Channel 4)

If Ryan and Lauren are voted in, Jack and Beth will be blocked from The Circle. If a pair wins the show, the cash prize will be split between them.

The results of the vote will be revealed on Sunday night’s episode.

The Circle continues on Sunday Channel 4 at 10pm.

description: The Circle has dropped a special twist and a new arrival in the latest episode.
